intro: Vernonia verrucata, commonly known as rough vernonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with rough, hairy surfaces, and the flowers are yellow to orange in color. Vernonia verrucata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
